channel.title: Pi Zepsity client connecting to Different source!
channel.description: How could i connect Zepsity client to InsidiaX base? It would really help

item.title: Pi Zepsity client connecting to Different source!
item.dc:creator: @marcus_nunez marcus nunez
item.description:
@marcus_nunez wrote:

Oh ok, well you have to make sure they are both 317 because Insidia is a 317 base. Just make sure you are running a 317 client because I have no clue what Zepsity client is. Try using TorvaPkz Client and see if that works.

Read full topic

item.title: Pi Zepsity client connecting to Different source!
item.dc:creator: @king_he_he king he he
item.description:
@king_he_he wrote:

No i know that part ive done that and can connect the insidaX client with this base but the Zepsity client wont connect with Insidia base

Read full topic
item.source: Pi Zepsity client connecting to Different source!

item.title: Pi Zepsity client connecting to Different source!
item.dc:creator: @marcus_nunez marcus nunez
item.description:
@marcus_nunez wrote:

Go into your Client.Java file in your Client folder and search for:

server.equals
or
server =

And look for any unknown ip adress other than 127.0.0.1
And switch the unknown IP adress to yours so it can connect to yours or switch it to 127.0.0.1
And make sure where they have the __________.no-ip.biz or something like that switch it to yours. And run No-Ip.Duct.
Let me know if this worked. If not let me know and maybe we could MSN eachother and figure it out.

Read full topic
